policy_paragraphs: Undergraduate students may take a maximum of 3 courses as Pass/Fail. The Pass/Fail policy is as follows:

*Additional restrictions on the Pass/Fail option vary according to the major department. Not all courses with the Pass/Fail attribute can be taken as Pass/Fail by all majors. A student must contact their major department concerning restrictions and check here for additional information .
Note: The Spring 2020 mandatory Pass/Fail policy and the Fall 2020 opt-in Pass/Fail policy do not apply to the 3 course maximum.

Students interested in taking a course under the Pass/Fail grading option must first register for an eligible course. Once a student is registered, then the student must submit a Pass/Fail Request Form . This request must be made by the last day to add/drop classes as indicated on the Academic Calendar .
